solution_line_template: During breakfast, Blanch has {initial_slices} - {breakfast_eaten} = <<{initial_slices}-{breakfast_eaten}={after_breakfast}>>{after_breakfast} slices left.
At lunch, she still has {after_breakfast} - {lunch_eaten} = <<{after_breakfast}-{lunch_eaten}={after_lunch}>>{after_lunch} slices left.
After the snack, there are still {after_lunch} - {snack_eaten} = <<{after_lunch}-{snack_eaten}={after_snack}>>{after_snack} slices left.
Finally after dinner, Blanch has {after_snack} - {dinner_eaten} = <<{after_snack}-{dinner_eaten}={after_dinner}>>{after_dinner} slices left.
